Description: Part of a jar-seal: baked pale red by fire, bearing the impression of a seal showing a row of seated figures of Djer in the regalia of the Sed-festival. The figures wear the crown of Upper and Lower Egypt alternately.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl.XV, 108; H. R. Hall, 'Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs etc. in the British Museum: Volume 1 : Royal scarabs' (London, 1913), 287, no.2755; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl.67, abb.237; see also vols. I, 76 and II, 738, n. 353; 1124.
